gurmukhi: ਮੀਨ ਕੳੁ ਨ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਜਲ ਕੳੁ ਸਬਦ ਗਿਅਾਨੁ ਦੁਬਿਧਾ ਮਿਟਾੲਿ ਨ ਸਕਤ ਜਲੁ ਮੀਨ ਕੀ
transliteration: Meen Kau N Surati Jal Kau Sabad Giaanu , Doubidhaa Mitaai N Sakat Jalu Meen Kee ?
translation: A fish is not a ware that the water will assist nor does water have knowledge of speech or hearing in order to help the fish in distress. Therefore the water cannot allay its pain while it is in distress.

gurmukhi: ਸਰ ਸਰਿਤਾ ਅਥਾਹ ਪ੍ਰਬਲ ਪ੍ਵਾਹ ਬਸੈ ਗ੍ਰਸੈ ਲੋਹ ਰਾਖਿ ਨ ਸਕਤ ਮਤਿ ਹੀਨ ਕੀ
transliteration: Sar Saritaa Adaah Prabal Pravaah Basai , Grasai Loh Raakhi N Sakat Mati Heen Kee ?
translation: Fish resides in the vast and rapid flow of the river. But when it swallows the iron bait of an angler, the bemused fish cannot be saved by water-her beloved.

gurmukhi: ਜਲੁ ਬਿਨੁ ਤਰਫਿ ਤਜਤ ਪ੍ਰਿਅ ਪ੍ਰਾਨ ਮੀਨ ਜਾਨਤ ਨ ਪੀਰ ਨੀਰ ਦੀਨਤਾੲੀ ਦੀਨ ਕੀ
transliteration: Jalu Binu Taradhi Tajat Pria Praan Meena , Jaanat N Peer Neer Deenataaee Deen Kee ?
translation: Removed from water, a fish writhes in pain for life having been separated from its beloved (life support). But the water is not aware of the sufferings of the fish.

gurmukhi: ਦੁਖਦਾੲੀ ਪ੍ਰੀਤਿ ਕੀ ਪ੍ਰਤੀਤ ਮੀਨ ਕੁਲ ਦ੍ਰਿੜ ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਬੰਸ ਧ੍ਰਿਗੁ ਪ੍ਰੀਤਿ ਪਰਧੀਨ ਕੀ ||੩੧੭||
transliteration: Doukhadaaee Preeti Kee Prateet Meen Kul Drirha , Gursikh Bans Dhrigu Preeti Paradheen Kee ?317?
translation: The entire clan of fish is bearing with this one-sided love for eons. But the love of a Guru and his disciple is always two-sided. Guru helps the Sikh in distress. But one who being in the clan, leaves the love of True Guru, submits himself and serves spu
